Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of at least five lines of Coptic text in black ink, now very worn and faded, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.218)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36501) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36501)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 380 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
